      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">

          <title>
            <string language="en">Ionic and covalent compounds</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Ionen- und kovalente Mittel</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Composés ioniques et covalents</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Compostos ionic e covalent</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Residui ionici e covalenti</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ιοντικές και ομοιοπολικές ενώσεις</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Compuestos iónicos y covalentes</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows the molecular structure of table salt and water. It shows that the compound NaCl or table salt is an ionic compound where the atoms are bonded by the forces of attraction between ions of opposite charges, while water is a covalent compound where the atoms in each molecule share electrons to form covalent bonds.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Atoms</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">chemical bonds</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">chemical structure</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">chlorine</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">covalent bonds</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">covalent compounds</string>
          </keyword>

            <string language="en">elements</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">hydrogen</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">ionic compounds</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">ions</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">molecular structure</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">negative charge</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">oxygen</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">positive charge</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">salt</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">sodium</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">substances</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">water</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt die molekulare Struktur des
Tabelle Salzes und des Wassers. Sie zeigt, daß das 
zusammengesetzte NaCl oder Tabelle Salz ein Ionenmittel ist, in dem 
die Atome durch die Kräfte der Anziehung zwischen Ionen der 
gegenüberliegenden Ladungen abgebunden werden, während Wasser ein 
kovalentes Mittel ist, in dem die Atome in jedem Molekül Elektronen 
teilen, um kovalente Bindungen zu bilden.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration montre la structure 
moléculaire du sel et de l'eau de table. Elle prouve que le sel
composé de NaCl ou de table est un composé ionique où les atomes 
sont liés par les forces de l'attraction entre les ions des frais 
opposés, alors que l'eau est un composé covalent où les atomes en 
chaque molécule partagent des électrons pour former les obligations
covalentes.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra a estrutura molecular do
sal e da água da tabela. Mostra que o sal composto do NaCl ou 
da tabela é um composto ionic onde os átomos estejam ligados pelas 
forças da atração entre íons de cargas opostas, quando a água for
um composto covalent onde os átomos em cada molécula compartilhem de
elétrons para dar forma a ligações covalent.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra la struttura 
molecolare del sale e dell'acqua della tabella. Indica che il 
sale compound della tabella o del NaCl è un residuo ionico in cui gli
atomi sono legati dalle forze dell'attrazione fra gli ioni delle spese
opposte, mentre l'acqua è un residuo covalente in cui gli atomi in 
ogni molecola ripartiscono gli elettroni per formare i legami 
covalenti.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση εμφανίζει μοριακή δομή του 
επιτραπέζιων άλατος και του ύδατος. Δείχνει ότι το σύνθετο
άλας NaCl ή πινάκων είναι μια ιοντική ένωση όπου τα άτομα 
συνδέονται από τις δυνάμεις της έλξης μεταξύ των ιόντων των 
αντίθετων δαπανών, ενώ το ύδωρ είναι μια ομοιοπολική ένωση 
όπου τα άτομα σε κάθε μόριο μοιράζονται τα ηλεκτρόνια για να 
διαμορφώσουν τους ομοιοπολικούς δεσμούς.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra la estructura molecular
de la sal y del agua del vector. Muestra que la sal compuesta 
del NaCl o del vector es un compuesto iónico donde los átomos son 
pegados por las fuerzas de la atracción entre los iones de cargas 
opuestas, mientras que el agua es un compuesto covalente donde los 
átomos en cada molécula comparten electrones para formar enlaces 
covalentes.</string>
          </description>
